Before the dawn of Apple Silicon, a Mac couldn't game. Despite sharing the same x86 Intel hardware as many PCs, Apple's computers lack the discrete graphics cards, driver support, and core focus to really find success in desktop gaming. And that's speaking nothing of the thermal throttling issues they encountered for years. The few people that did want to game on a M
title: Apple’s Last Chance to Win Gamers
